content.en: Lung cancer diagnosis: Researchers have investigated the use of algorithms in various techniques for diagnosing and staging lung cancer. They found that endoscopic ultrasound-guided fine-needle aspiration (EUS-FNA) can reduce the need for surgical interventions in lung cancer patients. Additionally, transbronchial needle aspiration (TBNA) and endobronchial ultrasound-guided TBNA (EBUS-TBNA) are effective and safe methods for diagnosing and staging lung cancer, potentially avoiding more invasive procedures like mediastinoscopy. These findings highlight the potential of algorithms in improving the accuracy and safety of lung cancer diagnosis and staging.
content.da: Diagnose af lungekræft: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer i forskellige teknikker til diagnosticering og stadieinddeling af lungekræft. De fandt, at endoskopisk ultralyd-styret finnålsaspiration (EUS-FNA) kan reducere behovet for kirurgiske indgreb hos lungekræftpatienter. Derudover er transbronchial nåleaspiration (TBNA) og endobronchial ultralyd-styret TBNA (EBUS-TBNA) effektive og sikre metoder til diagnosticering og stadieinddeling af lungekræft, hvilket potentielt kan undgå mere invasive procedurer som mediastinoskopi. Disse fund fremhæver potentialet ved algoritmer i at forbedre nøjagtigheden og sikkerheden af diagnose og stadieinddeling af lungekræft.
